data.title: Princess Iman bint Abdullah of Jordan Gets Married
data.meta_description: Inside the wedding of Princess Iman Bint Abdullah II and Mr. Jameel Alexander Thermiotis.
data.text:
HRH Princess Iman

The beautiful Princess, 26 years old, stunned everyone with her elegance and simplicity as she walked into her wedding ceremony accompanied by her older brother, Jordan’s Crown Prince Al Hussein bin Abdullah II. Prince Al Hussein will also be getting married this year to his fiance Rajwa Al Saif.

The bride looked gorgeous wearing a delicate custom-made white wedding dress designed by French fashion house Dior, pairing it with a beautiful Chaumet tiara. The long-sleeved bridal gown featured a full-length skirt in silk organza, a sheer lace panel, and lace-cuffed sleeves. Princess Iman's veil was embroidered with flowers. Her train was nearly 10 feet long and made a dramatic entry into the palace.

Dior PR Manager, Mathilde Favier, shared the news and announced the designer, Maria Garza Chiuri, behind the stunning gown across her Instagram account.

Princess Iman's look was completed with the touches of the Dubai-based Jordanian makeup artist Muhammad Hindash.

Jameel Alexander Thermiotis

Coming from a prominent Greek family, Jameel, and his family maintain a strong connection to their heritage with frequent trips to the island of Andros.

Princess Iman’s fiance founded Outbound Ventures LLC after he graduated from university, he’s now a managing partner in a New York City venture capital firm.

For his marriage ceremony, Jameel wore a black suit with a grey waistcoat.

The Wedding Planners and Vendors

Ahead of the nuptials, the Queen shared a sneak peek of the decor, while she also announced that the wedding planner of the ceremony is Jordan-based ADegrees by Abdallah Assi.

Once the couple signed their marriage contract they celebrated with a traditional Jordanian zaffa as they walked into their reception together. The zaffa was by the famous Maan Zaffa Group of Jordan.

The official photographer of the ceremony was Farras Oran who captured the beautiful moments of this special day.

The Decor and Theme

The decor and planning were all done by Abdullah Assi of Adegrees, Abdullah revealed that the design of the ceremony was all about striking simplicity and sophistication in soft earthy colors, and the venue was with spring florals, such as the pretty cherry blossom flower. Anemone flowers were also used to decorate the tables.

White candles were also used to add some warmth and romance to the venue.

Abdullah shared the pictures on his Instagram account describing the theme: "The theme was Earth inspired in neutral colors that complemented a simple yet elegant and royal design."
